column4: Im having problems with my Atheros Wi-Fi Driver. Can someone help me fix it?
Can someone help me fix my Atheros Wi-Fi?
!help
!atheros
!Networking
Im having issues with my internet drivers.
Im fine on a wired connection like right now, but I have noticed that on laptops, Ubuntu doesnt come with Wi-Fi fixes to get online imemediately.
It is Atheros I think.
is there anything in /proc/net/wireless?  (do cat /proc/net/wireless)
yeah... doesn't look like the module is installed
So how do I fix it?
is it builtin wifi?
is it a pcmcia card you are using for wifi? or built-in wifi?
is there a *card* plugged into your laptop or not?
do I understand that you are trying to get wireless working?
can you answer Ryan_was_here's question?
did you load ndiswrapper?
that means you didn't
did you *ever* have wifi working with this current linux install on that laptop?
did you say you never goit it working?
do you still have the vista partition on the laptop?
you are going to need the windows drivers to get it to work
is this a dual boot system?
Yes, and please join #linuxreality
